Merging Folder or Item Properties Manually

When you use the View Comparison utility, you can merge the properties of child folders and items in both of the selected folders. You can merge file properties as well, but merging files also allows you to merge their contents.

To merge the properties of child folders or items:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select a folder from the source view and a folder from the target view.

  4. Select one or more folders or items from the item pane. At least one item must have an icon indicating that it requires the type of merge you want to perform (to source or to target).

  5. From the Item or context menu, select Merge Items > To Source or Merge Items > To Target. The <item> Merge dialog opens. This dialog displays four columns that show:

    • Names of the properties.

    • Values of the properties in the source folder or item.

    • Values of the properties in the target folder or item.

    • Suggested merged properties. The merge process compares the source and target properties.

      • If a property’s value is the same in both items, the value appears in the Merged column. (Either no changes have taken place or both the source and target have changed in identical ways.)

      • If a property’s value is different in both items, the application displays the row in boldface type and puts a value in the Merged column based on the following principles:

    If the values for a given property were the same at the time of the last recorded merge and only one has changed since, the changed value appears by default in the Merged column. In all other cases, the value that appears by default in the Merged column is the value of the property in the view to which you are merging.

  6. Review the properties in boldface type, if any. These are the properties that are different.

  7. To change the value in the Merged column to the value that appears in the From or To column:

    1. Select the property.

    2. Click Apply from or Apply to. Apply from places the value in the From column in the Merged column, while Apply to places the value in the To column in the Merged column.

  8. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Record merge check box so that the application records the revision of the corresponding item in the other view that was involved in this merge. If you select this check box and track merges, a merge in the current direction (source or target) cannot be performed until the corresponding item changes. Thus, two corresponding items may be different but not need a merge. If you are not tracking merges, the application will indicate that two corresponding items that are different need to be merged.

    • Clear the Record merge check box if you do not want to record this merge. If you track merges but do not record this merge, this pair of items will continue to be available for a merge in this direction after the merge is complete.

  9. Do one of the following to save the merged folder or item's properties as a revision in the source or target.

    • Click OK and exit the dialog.

    • Click Apply to remain in the dialog.

  10. If you selected Apply, use the Previous and Next buttons to move from one pair of items with an appropriate icon to the next.

Notes: When a new revision is created during a merge, the revision’s Comment field provides merge information. This information identifies the item from the other view that was used in the merge. For example, if you merge files, the Comment might be "Merge from MAINFRM.CPP, Revision 1.3.1.9".
